document.text:
From: 
Subject: Re: Epstein priv review —  1B72 released and update 
Date: Tue, 03 Nov 2020 22:16:31 +0000 
Inline-Images: image001.png 
Terrific. Thanks so much for getting this done, much appreciated. 
Sent from my iPhone 
On 
Nov 3, 2020, at 5:05 PM,] wrote: 
Per below, we released two more devices today, will release two more tonight, and the final one tomorrow. 
Thanks,
From 
5 
To: 
:03 PM 
3. 
Subject: RE: Epstein priv review -- 1872 released and update 
I'm loading 1872 to your shared directory now. We did not remove any potentially privileged materials. As stressed 
below, do not try to open from the shared directory. 
Enrique is generating NP reports for 1869 and 1884. 
W/r/t 1884, we are removing 169 PP emails, so there will be 1762 emails, and we are removing one PP chat (with 
Darren Indyke) so there will be 243 chats. 
W/r/t 1869, we are removing 93 PP emails, so there will be 1074 emails. 
I'll finish 1871 tomorrow. 
And as always, stop your review and let me know if you come across anything that you think may be privileged. 
And thank for all the help today!! 
From 
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 1:12 PM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Epstein priv review --1B83 released 
Got it, thank you so 
much! 
From:
Sent: Tuesday, November 3, 2020 1:09 PM 
To: 
EFTA00018089

Subject: Epstein priv review -- 1683 released 
We just finished 1683. 30 emails were removed as potentially privileged. The redacted report is saved to your shared 
directory below but DO NOT open it from the shared or it will shut down the office network. Save it to your D drive or 
Enrique can put it on a  flashdrive. 
From:
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 11:09 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Thank you so much, 
From:
Sent: Tuesday, November 3, 2020 11:08 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
The first two phones are up on the Priv share. (71 and 72). 
From'

you!

on a  rolling basis to

Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 10:17 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Great, can you do 1B72 first and if we still don't have a PRIV shared directory, email it to just me? The case team is on a 
tight discovery deadline so I want to getreviewing asap. 
Thanks,
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 10:13 AM 
To: 
EFTA00018090

Cc: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Got it. This will take me 
a  few hours to complete. I'll let you know when it's done. 
From:
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 9:51 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Great! Can you create the following extractions from the Epstein HD? And save them to the Priv shared directory as 
soon as I can create one? And then I'll ha‘-start reviewing them for privilege. 
1B71— Chats and SMS 
1872 —  Chats 
1869 - Chats 
1884 —  Chats 
1883 - Chats 
From:
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 9:47 AM 
To: 
Subject: Re: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Yes I'm in. Let me know what you need. 
Investigative Analyst 
U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY 
On Nov 3, 2020, at 9:37 AM, wrote: 
Hi 
Can you help me today on this? 
Thanks,
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 9:33 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Do you guys have a shared directory? Can you send me the link? I need to set up a Privilege shared directory. 
Thanks,M 
From:
Sent: Tuesday, November 03, 2020 9:16 AM 
To: 
EFTA00018091

Cc 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Hi
-
or correct me if they have a better way but I think the best way to generate the Responsive Report 
is to deselect (by removing the x in the column on the far left) all the data in the report and then go to the Tags view 
and select (by putting the x back in the column on the far left) all your tags. You then go up to the top left and choose 
the Report drop down and then choose Generate a  New Report. Be sure to name it something that makes it clear that 
it is the Responsive report and you can also choose whether to create a  UFDR report or a  PDF. 
I'll give you an update on the other reports shortly. 
Than
From: 
Sent: Monday, November 02, 2020 9:59 PM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
I've finished the responsiveness review of the four reports that Reggie generated last week. I've tagged all of the 
responsive items in each report. What should my next step be to generate reports that only include the tagged items? 
Now that these are done, and I are all just waiting on the release of the remaining portions of 1872 and 
1869, as well as any content from 1B71, 1883, and 1884. As soon as you can release even just some of those reports, 
we will dive into the responsiveness review. 
To give you a sense of timing: In order to give our paralegals enough time to prepare the responsive materials for 
production in time for our 11/9 deadline, we need to finish the responsiveness review by no later than Thursday 11/5. 
So the sooner we can get anything over the wall for us to review, the better. 
Thanks very much, 
From: 
Sent: Thursday, October 29, 2020 11:11 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Just to be safe, please double check when you open up the reports that they correspond to the notes below, i.e., 1872 
should not have chats and 1B69 should not have chats and should only have 1074 emails. And as always please stop 
your review and let me know if you come across anything else that you think may be privileged. Thanks! 
1B72 —  Release without chats 
1867 —  Release entire report 
1868 —  Release entire report 
1869 —  Release without chats and without the 93 PP emails, as tagged on the attached .pas file (so only release 1074 
emails) 
From: 
Sent: Thursday, October 29, 2020 11:08 AM 
To: 
Cc 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
EFTA00018092

You can stop by now if you'd like. I have the drive. 
From: 
Sent: Thursday, October 29, 2020 11:04 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Thank 
you! 
please let me know when would be a good time for me to swing by. 
From:
Sent: Thursday, October 29, 2020 11:03 AM 
To: 
Subject: Re: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
I'm not in the office today, but I left the reports copying overnight to a flash drive. See and he can give 
it to you. 
Sent from my iPhone 
On Oct 29, 2020, at 11:01 AM, wrote: 
Hi all, 
I'm in the office today and available to pick up the released reports from these devices if they are ready. 
Thanks,

Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review

1867 —  Release entire report 
1868 —  Release entire report 
1869 —  Release without chats and without the 93 PP emails, as tagged on the attached .pas file (so only release

EFTA00018094

Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Do you still have a  copy of this drive in the office? If so, would you be able to coordinate with Lisa to help get 
portions of those files ready for me to conduct a responsiveness review? 
Thanks very much, 
From 
Sent: Monday, August 24, 2020 11:26 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
The drive is done being copied and is going out via FedEx to=oday. It should arrive tomorrow. 
Please let me know if there is anything else I can do to be of assistance.

Sent: Friday, August 21, 2020 3:44 PM

thanks.

Just checked with IT again about the drive; they unfortunately ran into some issue when copying it and have to 
restart the copy over the weekend. Hopefully, per IT's diagnosis and apology for the delay, it will be ready Monday or 
Tuesday. 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2020 5:18 PM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Thanks for 
staying on top of it —appreciate the update. 
From 
Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2020 5:18 PM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Just FYI, the drive is still being copied—I was apparently overeager with my expectations for how long it would take. I 
will let you know once it is ready and I've put it in the mail for= 
From 
Sent: Monday, August 17, 2020 3:30 PM 
To: 
EFTA00018095

Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Thanks very much. 
From: 
Sent: Monday, August 17, 2020 3:28 PM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Update on this: I asked aw copy the drive this morning with the aim that it would be done in time to 
mail this afternoon, but he's left for the day and did not leave me with an ETA for it being finished being copied. I'll 
check back in with him in the morning and hope to have it sent to= tomorrow. 
From:
Sent: Friday, August 14, 2020 8:20 PM 
To: 
Subject: Re: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
Perfect, thank you! 
On Aug 14, 2020, at 8:16 PM) wrote: 
Hi Maurene and Lisa, 
Thanks for the welcome and for your emails. I will get on this first thing Monday morning, as I had just left the 
office when Maurene's email came in. 
Hope you all have great weekends, and more soon. 
Best, 
Sunny 
Sent from my iPhone

Sent: Friday, August 14, 2020 5:22 PM 
To 
Subject: Help with Epstein Privilege Review 
First, welcome to the unit! I'm sorry we have not met yet, but I'm looking forward to meeting you when we are 
both in the office one day. 
EFTA00018096

I'm hoping you would be able to help us with some logistics for the privilege review of data extracted from 
several of Jeffrey Epstein's devicesMs going to leave a drive on your desk today, which contains data from 
several of Epstein's phones and ipads. Would you please copy of all of that data onto a second drive? 
Once the data is copied, we then need you to please mail one of the drives 
t' 
(who is cc'd and will 
reply to this email with her mailing address). Please keep the second drive in your files in the officall then 
reach out to you if she needs any additional help coordinating the review of that data for privileged materials. 
Please let me know if you have any questions, and thanks so much for your help.
